title: ¿QUÉ SON LAS PERSONAS NO BINARIAS?
creator: Infobae;Marico Carmona
description: Short video introducing non-binary language in Spanish and non-binary people.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish;Educational Material

title: Narrativas no binarias: Testimonios de identidades por fuera del binario heterocisexista y sus interseccionalidades.
creator: Alas Alexis;Ama Boadiceas;capitanx cuir;Florián Vives (ed.);Kümelen Berti;Marcos Varela Dugo;Marlene Wayar;Nauhi Vega;Nói Urrutia-Nói Leber;SNC;Tegan Mai Guanco'Todes con DNI;Tuqui;Valentine Ayre Luy Machado;Violeta Alegre
description: Anthology containing texts made by trans and non-binary authors.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish; Poetry;Indirect Non-Binary Spanish

title: Furia travesti: diccionario de la T a la T
creator: Marlene Wayar
description: Autotheory book experimenting with travesti epistemologies.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish;Indirect Non-Binary Spanish;Autobiography;Autotheory

title: Historia de la monja alférez
creator: Catalina de Erauso;Antonio de Erauso
description: Memoir by the lieutenant de Erauso, born as Catalina de Erauso and lived under different masculine names. Erauso shift between the use of masculine and feminine grammatical gender to encompass their gender experience in Latin America. At times, Erauso completely ommits gender markers, shaping language to represent themselves.
subject: Indirect Non-Binary Spanish;Colonial Production

title: Mapa mundi del reino de las indias
creator: Felipe Guamán Poma de Ayala
description: Colonial map of Cusco, Peru (center of the Inca empire) from a mostly Andean cosmological perspective revealing complimentary depictions of personhood. The map supposedly has a gendered reading where there is an "underworld" of gender and sexual ambivalence, which has been described as lo masculino femenino and lo femenino masculino.
subject: Colonial Production

title: Vocabulario en la lengua castellana y mechuacana
creator: Maturino Gylberti
description: Full text here. Colonial dictionary of Michoacana written by a Spanish friar that describes the binary imposition placed on gendered bodies who supposedly display different gendered and/or presentational variations, as seen in the items "muger varonil," "muger que lo haze a otra," and "ombre de grá nariz".
subject: Colonial Production

title: Vocabulario en lengua misteca
creator: Francisco de Alvarado
description: Full text here. Colonial dictionary of the Mixteco language written by Spanish friars that demonstrates more evidence of the categorization of Indigenous people along binary gendered dimensions, as in the items "mujer casta" and "muger carnal".
subject: Colonial Production

title: Sexismo y lenguaje
creator: Álvaro García Meseguer
description: Early short essay from a Spanish engineer proposing the use of the -e morpheme for a new linguistic gender corresponding to 'person', including examples of its usage as attested in the present day.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish

title: Nota al uso del lenguaje
creator: Grupo Anarquista Pirexia
description: Manifesto by the Spanish anarchist group Pirexia describing their logic behind the use of gender-inclusive language in their texts, discussing the pros and cons of possible gender-inclusive alternatives, and establishing the use of the -e morpheme throughout their writings.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish

title: Proposición X. Género y sexo en el lenguaje escrito
creator: Garazi Lara Icaza
description: Full text here. Master's thesis in Fine Arts that describes the use of the -x as a transfeminist artistic proposal to undermine the rigidity of the gender binary.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish

title: Amigue, Date Cuenta: Por Qué, Cómo y para Qué Deberías Usar el Lenguaje No Binario
creator: Gabriel D’Artemius;Begoña Martínez Pagán
description: Manual on how to use gender-inclusive language in Spanish.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish

title: Varela
creator: Tegan Mai Guanco
description: Anthology of poems by the trans author Tegan Mai Guanco.
subject: Direct Non-Binary Spanish

title: Lo que pasa en la piel
creator: Morgan Herbas Loureiro

title: La conspiración de lxs niñxs
creator: Camille Louis
description: Originally written with the gender-inclusive title "La conspiration des enfants," the translator from Spain utilized Direct Non-Binary Spanish to translate the work.

title: Antología de poesía trava/trans*/no binarie

description: Anthology of poems written by trans and non-binary authors.

description: Argentinian novel, often referred to as the first novel in gender-inclusive Spanish.

title: Futuro problema

title: Prometo fallar

title: Martes Verdes

title: Sonetos
